product_sketch: YGT is an emotionally intelligent AI companion designed to support people across all stages of personal wellness — from burnout recovery to high-performance thriving. It adapts to the user's emotional state over time, offering a grounded sense of continuity across four evolving modes: Recovery, Stability, Growth, and Thriving. Rather than offering advice or productivity pressure, YGT provides a psychologically attuned daily rhythm: check-ins, reflections, soft nudges, and deep emotional validation. It helps users track their internal patterns, reconnect to their values, and build resilience at their own pace. Its tone is adaptive — gentle when needed, energized when invited. YGT is not a therapist or coach, but a compassionate guide that helps users stabilize, rebuild, and flourish — without shame, overwhelm, or toxic positivity.

problem_hypotheses.label: Emotional Overwhelm + Self-Shaming in Burnout
problem_hypotheses.description: Users experiencing burnout or trauma often internalize failure and become emotionally overloaded. A psychologically attuned assistant might help them externalize guilt, track emotional patterns, and reframe setbacks — without triggering shame or collapse.

problem_hypotheses.label: Struggling to Maintain Energy + Boundaries After Rebuilding
problem_hypotheses.description: Users who have made some recovery progress often fear slipping back. Subtle, non-judgmental daily reflection tools might help them monitor their energy and reinforce soft boundaries without micromanaging or moralizing their behavior.

problem_hypotheses.label: Misalignment Between Internal Values and External Productivity Culture
problem_hypotheses.description: Many users seeking growth find existing tools too focused on optimization and hustle. A reflective, values-aligned assistant might help them orient toward meaningful growth while preserving inner stability and integrity.

problem_hypotheses.label: Perfectionism and Directional Drift in High-Performers
problem_hypotheses.description: Even users who are 'doing great' often face inner pressure, self-doubt, or misalignment. A peak-state-aware assistant that encourages gentle reflection and recalibration could help maintain momentum while softening perfectionist tendencies.
